summary: Completed comprehensive testing of HospitalityHub MVP - job portal for hospitality workers. Backend APIs working well (15/16 tests passed), restaurant flow fully functional, but worker registration has role selection issue preventing proper worker flow testing.

minor_bugs.issue: Backend test login failed due to timestamp-based phone number mismatch
minor_bugs.impact: Test implementation issue, not actual functionality bug

ui_bugs.issue: Role selector defaults to 'restaurant' even when 'worker' is selected, causing workers to be registered as restaurants
ui_bugs.impact: Blocks entire worker registration and job browsing flow

integration_issues.issue: Due to role selection bug, workers are registered as restaurants and redirected to restaurant dashboard instead of worker jobs page

console_errors.error: Failed to load resource: 400/404 status codes
console_errors.context: Profile creation endpoints when profiles don't exist yet
console_errors.note: Expected behavior for new users without profiles

passed_tests: Landing page loads with all sections (hero, features, CTA)
Job browsing API returning correct data
Professional UI design with proper data-testid attributes
action_item_for_main_agent: Fix role selector in registration form - the dropdown is not properly setting the selected role value, causing all registrations to default to 'restaurant' role instead of the selected 'worker' role. This is blocking the entire worker flow testing.

success_percentage.frontend: 75% (restaurant flow working, worker flow blocked by role selection bug)
